sister.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a girl or woman who has the same parents as you
sister.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He has two sisters and a brother.
My older sister is a nurse.
sister.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a nurse in charge of a hospital ward
sister.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I’m feeling a bit better today, Sister.
sister.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a word used by women to talk about other women and to show that they have feelings of friendship and support towards them
sister.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: We appeal to our sisters all over the world to stand by us.
sister.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a way of talking to or about an African-American woman, used especially by African Americans
sister.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He had two older sisters, Karen and Jacqueline.
She misses her big sister dreadfully.
Mary showed a lot of aggressive behaviour towards her younger sister.
She was very fond of her little sister.
He is devoted to his twin sister.
